testimony: Thank you, Mr Chairman.  The application in front of you is that of Mr Verwey.  It is found in the Cele bundle on page 168, and in front of you I've had placed a short summary of the evidence.  If we can possibly mark that Exhibit - I think the next on is G.
Mr Verwey will be testifying in Afrikaans.
Thank you, you may be seated.

Thank you, Mr Chair.
	Mr Verwey, you are applying in terms of the Act for amnesty, for your involvement in the abduction of the case that we have heard here, that would be Dion Cele, and any other offence which may emanate therefrom.  Is that correct?

You have heard the evidence of the previous applicants who have testified and you have also had the opportunity to peruse Exhibit A, do you confirm the correctness of that exhibit as well as the evidence given by the previous applicants regarding your involvement?
Mr Verwey, during this incident you were stationed in the SAP at Middelburg.
You were at the Security Branch, and what was your involvement there?
I was a Warrant Officer for the Security Branch.
And am I correct in saying that Col Taylor from the Durban Security Branch during this time contacted you to assist in an operation which would take place in Swaziland?
Now why would he have approached you specifically?
We worked in Swaziland regularly and we knew the roads and the environment very well.

Now as I've said, you have heard the evidence of the previous applicants and your involvement in this operation was exclusively to offer assistance with a possible, if I may call it, escape route from Swaziland to the RSA.

You say, or you summarise the incident on page 172 of your application and that this is correct, with the exception that you mentioned in your application that Sam du Preez was also one of the members who was present during this operation.
Am I correct in saying that during consultation and in consultation with Mr du Preez, it appeared clearly that you were mistaken and that he was not involved at all in this operation?

Furthermore, you summarise your political objective on page 174 in question 10(a) of your application.  Do you confirm the correctness thereof and request that this be incorporated in your application?
And this is question 10(a), which paragraph, paragraph 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, all of them?
All of them, Mr Chairperson.  That is the ...(intervention)
Did you draw any financial benefit or reward from your participation in this operation?
After Cele had been taken from Swaziland, did you participate in any way in the interrogation?
And you and Labuschagne then returned to your station?

Mr Chairperson, that is the evidence.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR NEL
Thank you.  Mr Visser, are there any questions you with to put?
I have no questions, thank you, Mr Chairman.
Thank you.  Is there any cross-examination at all?

No, Mr Chair, thank you.
NO QUESTIONS BY MS THABETHE
So the limit of your participation is to get this man out of Swaziland and when you got back into the country that was the end of your participation?

Just one question, Chairperson.
	Did you have any inkling about what might happen to this man after you left the scene?
I see in paragraph 9 of your application that you have applied for conspiracy to abduct.  Where you indeed a member of the planning or were you just told to be there so that you could indicate roads?
We were there because we knew the routes and the environment very well.
But you were aware that this person was going to be abducted?
Yes, we knew this before the time.
Thank you.  Thank you, Mr Chairperson.
